review: I have seen this movie dozens of times, but each time I see it I am still riveted. Each time I see different nuances in the characters and the acting that I might have missed previously. The characters are so well crafted and 3-dimensional that by the end of the film you also feel as if you have been locked in the jury room along with them. Words can hardly do this film justice. If you haven't already seen it, check it out. If you have, watch it again. A truly phenomenal film.

title: Truly the most powerful film you will ever see.
review: I consider my self to be a real war buff. I Have watched a HUGE number of war movies in my time. My library of books on the subject of war dwarfs that of my local library. I have visited many battlefields and have spent many hours conversing with veterans. However after seeing this film I realised I knew NOTHING of war. the sense of loss, of sadness, of destruction is overpowering. I have never cried after seeing a film. In fact I find it very difficult to cry in general. But about an hour after seeing this film I broke down and cried like never before in my life. That is true art. Saving Private Ryan has often been sited as being in the same league as this in other reviews here. I find this insulting. Don't get me wrong, I absolutely loved SPR, but to mention it in the same breath as this is just wrong. An event in my life recently reminded me quite strongly of Come And See. There is a beautiful forested aria not far from where I live. An aria of outstanding natural beauty. I have gone for walks there since I was a child, and continued to do so for many years. Some of my happiest memories are of the beauty and tranquillity of that forest. Then about a year ago there was a forest fire. My beautiful forest was gone. Come And See evoked the same feelings of loss and sadness but more intensely. Those were only trees -beautiful although they were- but these were real people. Although Come And See is not based on a true story per se, it is firmly grounded in history, with 628 similar instances. If this film touched you as deeply as it did me, I would recommend a trip to the Khatyn Memorial in Belarus.

title: Move over Skywalker, Aragorn's here!
review: Definitely a milestone for adventure/fantasy movies! How can one write about this movie? To me, it'd be like trying to sum up Egypt's history in one sentence. One can only imagine what sights we'll see in the next two years with the second and third installments of this amazing trilogy. Those who complained about this movie's slowness will be singing a different tune when they see the Ents sacking Isengard, or the utter hugeness (for lack of a better word) of the War of the Ring! Star Wars fans - move over! Star Trek fans - take a seat! There'll be no room for others when these films are complete.

title: The Ultimate Test of Survival-with some real life facts
review: This movie is the extremely accurate rendition of the incredible heroics of the brave men in Japanese prison camps that were made to build railroads. Many of these men after surviving battle on ships, ship sinkings, environmental and weather elements, were then subjected to cruel and inhuman treatment of Japanese soldiers. This movie is an accurate portrayal of these conditions with a few exceptions: (1) They did not whistle when entering the camp(although they did march in military formation, even when captured). (2) In the movie, Cdr. Shears tells the story of how he was on the USS Houston at the time she was sunk ,and how he and a Commander was separated from everyone else and drifted to the other side of the island. The commander died and he took his rank...etc. In real life, there was a USS Houston that was sunk and there was a Commander Maer that did drift to the other side of the island with a Seaman Elam ,which is consistent with Cdr. Shears story of the Houston sinking. However, both Cdr. Maer and Seaman Elam survived and were captured.(3) Real conditions of the prison camps were far more deplorable than depicted ,as well as the work details. (Men that couldn't walk were put on stretchers and given a hammer to bust up rock etc). (4) There were more American POWS than depicted in the movie, (the British often referred to the Americans as "Rabble"). and (5) They did not blow up the Bridge in the end and Col Nicholson certainly didn't turn on his own people to attempt to keep the bridge from blowing up. Still an awesome movie that is a must see.

title: A Look into the Future
review: When discussing the works of Ripley Scott, it is extremely difficult at best not to use such cerebrally intimidating terms such as "eclectic", "noir", and "dazzling technology". As such, this review will attempt to keep such terms to a minimum. In 1979 Ridley Scotts second film that he ever made, "Alien", was a smash hit. (His first film ever was "The Duelist" in 1977, in case you were wondering). The movie Alien was hailed as a masterpiece in which he mixed visceral horror with science fiction. Its no surprise then, that Scott's third movie, he mixed film noir and science fiction in much the same way to make the technically astonishing movie "Blade Runner" based on the 1968 classic by Phillip Dick called "Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?". Although it did not do well at the box office, it is another stroke of genius. As the movie starts off, there is a virtual tour of futuristic Los Angeles. The movie watcher is made to feel as if they have awoken from a cryogenic chamber and are observing the changes that have taken place.: The weather and environmental color is drab, there are gigantic animated billboards offering goods and services(something that didn't exist in 1982 but already exists now), and that Coke is still around. Even though the scenes were constructed using 1982 technology, they are still breathless and when viewed on a flat screen TV are close to three dimensional. Next is the introduction to the melancholic Deckard (played by Harrison Ford) who in contrast of the Replicants that he chases, appears to take life for granted. The philosophical themes in this picture are endless. One popular philosophy is that Deckard himself is a Replicant this theory is doubtful as Replicants appear to be superior in strength and maybe even intelligence to humans. Deckard is only able to bring Replicants down to retirement by relying on the one edge that humans have over Replicants: experience. Since Replicants can only live for four years, they do not have as much experience at anything as their human counterparts. In addition to the movies in depth philosophy, Blade Runner makes several realistic predictions: (1) Los Angeles/California is predicted as being culturally isolated and diverse to the point of mayhem. This forecast is even more probable today, than it was in 1982. California and especially Los Angeles has already become extremely diverse culturally. Caucasians no longer represent the majority of the population. Additionally, each ethnic group tends to isolate from the other ethnic groups. There is Chinatown, Korea Town, Olvera Street, and Watts. Each neighborhood has its own cultures and languages that are not only spoken, but seen on Billboards and even street signs. Select cultures are even pandered to by the government. Even though it is currently the law to be a US Citizen to vote and to have a driver's license, and even though it is a requirement to read English to become a US citizen, Drivers License exams and ballots are written in Spanish and many of the Asian languages Right pr wrong,. there is no need or incentive for an immigrant to assimilate into one uniform society. (2) Technology continues to advance at a prolific rate. From 1982 to 2010, technology has grown tremendously. No one in 1982 would have dreamed of DVDs, flat screen TVs, GPS systems, iPods, or cell phones that do just about everything would be in wide use in 2010. Flying cars may not be far off. It would appear that the only thing that might prevent Replicants from ever being built would be a possible ethical/political dilemma much like the one that surrounds cloning. (3) The weather and environment appears to be drearier. As global warming theories and oil and other toxic spills become more prevalent, this event is quite possible. (4) Big Corporations still exist and exert their influence. From the Coke billboards to the billboards offering a better life on a space colony, consumers are still being told that their life is inadequate but could be made better if they purchased certain products or moved to a "better" location. Watching the movie leaves one with the feeling of awe. The realism of situations and special effects only serve to enhance this effect. This movie is a much watch for any fan of science fiction, or to anyone who wants to get a look into the future.

title: The Batman movie that we have all been waiting on.
review: This is what Batman is all about. Not a nipple clad cartoon, but a Batman that uses fear and his well explained gadgets to terrorize the criminals of Gotham city. The cast. What can you say about this amazing cast? Christian Bale shines as the caped crusader. Gary Oldman is a perfect young Gordon. Michael Caine is outstanding as Alfred Pennyworth. Cillian Murphy really stood out as Dr. Jonathan Crane. Ken Watanabe had a nice take on Ra's Al Ghul but the real star was Liam Neeson. His role as Ducard shows what an amazing actor he really is, and what a great mentor character he can pull off with well done dialog and directing. The only real trouble for me came from Katie Holmes. She looked very out of place and more like a lost teenager then a real district attorney. This Batman was set in a very real world, in a real looking Gotham city. The technology was believable and the use of CGI was not over blown for the first time this summer. This Batman had what so many others have been missing. A plot, a real character driven plot. Not a CGI driven effects show case. Christopher Nolan comes through in every way for this film. Looking at Batman Begins compared to Batman and Robin, Joel Schumacher should commit sepuku.

title: Foundation of CInema
review: I normally do not enjoy romances, however, there are a few exceptions, and Casablanca is a major one. This film has to be the best romance that I have ever seen, and even when not looking at the romantic elements it still is a fantastically written and performed film. Humphrey Bogart is still one of the best actors to ever grace American film, and from my experience rarely had a performance that was less than stellar. The dialogue is expertly written, and the camera work and lighting make the viewer feel like that they are almost there with the actors, feeling what they feel. This movie is essential to see for anyone claiming to enjoy movies, and is the quintessential romance and drama.

title: Classic Crime
review: Bogart in this film was truly masterful in his performance, and I would easily place him in the top 5 Hollywood actors of all time. This movie IS, the classic crime film, and I have not seen another that can even rattle its position in my mind. While watching it your mind will jump from one thing to another while you are trying to figure out what will happen next, and a sense of danger and excitement will creep up your spine while you cant help but enjoy yourself. It is easy to see that so many old style detective films tried to catch some of the glory and prestige from The Maltese Falcon, and that is how I imagine why they became such a popular genre in and of themselves.

title: The most powerful movie you will ever see
review: A while back, my roommate and myself decided to see a movie with a mutual friend of ours; as we couldn't come up with an idea by ourselves that sounded interesting (Clerks and L.A. Confidential came up, but we had both seen those), we asked our friend if she could bring a movie that none of us had seen but that was supposed to be well-made. Though a tall order to fill, I have to say she more than delivered when she brought American History X over. It was powerful, brutal, beautiful, and compelling; the last type of movie most of us college freshman typically see with friends on a friday night. American History X follows the story of a young, brilliant, and very charismatic leader (stunningly played by Edward Norton) of a gang of Neo-Nazis in California, as well as his younger brother's (played by Edward Furlong) involvement in the same group. I'm not going to tell you any more than that; one of the things I enjoyed most about it was that I knew nothing more than that, so the plot was truly captivating. Not that it cannot stand on it's own; far from it! To tell the truth, I had absolutely no interest in what I thought would be yet another p.c. movie hollywood decides to throw at its consumers of "Racism is the ultimate evil"; it's one of those subjects that has been beat to death, which makes Tony Kaye's (the director) job that much more difficult. However, Mr. Kaye does so in breathtaking fashion. Much like Memento (which, of course, came after X), a great deal of the film is told via flashback in black and white. Many of the movie's most violent and compelling scenes are set to a powerfully dramatic, classical score that would simply come off as cheesy in any other film I can think of. What all this does is sober you up, grab your attention by the throat and make you seriously consider what this movie has to say. And what it has to say is both easily comprehensible, and brilliantly correct. Instead of portraying all Neo-Nazis as stupid rednecks, demonic villains or unknowing pawns, Kaye creates characters with real dimensions to them. Most people would find it hard to believe, but it isn't long after the movie starts that you actually care about two young racists, and even understand where these young men come from. Another brilliant move by Kaye and X's writer, David McKenna, was to present the logical, intelligent arguments that Neo-Nazis use, and precisely show where exactly those arguments are flawed. Unlike most movies, Kaye actually has the balls to show Ed Norton arguing with a teacher from school against integration, and shows him winning the argument! Another important element of this film is the reason it is rated R: horrific violence. What is so unfortunate is that many, many people will not see this film simply because of its graphic content, yet that is what makes it so horrifying, so gripping, and so mentally lasting. It, along with Schindler's List, is a movie that everyone should see at some point in their life; after that, you probably won't ever want to see it again.

title: Two incomplete films
review: An extraordinary effort all for naught. The script presents us with two stories that are compelling in their own right, but when combined here are incomplete and ultimately unsatisfying. The story about the Spanish authorities tracking down guerrilla rebels is fine, although the brutal act of the Captain in charge are almost too much to be believed (his comeuppance at the hands of his maid is still a high point). The supernatural elements add nothing to this story. Ofelia's journey to regain her underworld throne has nothing to do with the activities of the Franco government, or her mother's marriage to the Captain. The ending makes both of these points more than clear. Del Toro would have served his audience better to have made two separate films from the elements he created, giving himself a chance to refine the characters and situations in each story. As it is, everything here seems arbitrary, and a bit over the top, and unconnected.

title: ignorance has its own rewards
review: His parents pay for his education and by of thanks he heads for the territories. His first act of independence is to park his car in a cutbank in the desert, an excellent method for taking a late night muddy swim. He then wanders the land in search of truth and justice, eventually hooking up with some latter day hippies who are a little wiser but not much smarter. He calls himself a tramp but since he burned his money he's really a bum mooching his way across America . Wouldn't you just love to find this guy hanging around your favorite summer retreat mooning away for walden pond. A great beginning for a summer vacation. He and his naivete eventually arrive in the frozen wilderness of Alaska where he thinks poetry and wishful thinking will provide sustenance. This pilgrim should have stayed with his mommy.

title: Not As Good as the Original Three, But Still Good
review: I just returned from the opening midnight showing of Star Wars: The Force Awakens. I'd say first off that the movie seems pretty typical for a J.J. Abrams movie: strong on character development and action, but weak on plot. I'd say though that perhaps the plot had a little more strength than the typical Abrams movie, while the character development and especially the action didn't quite rise to Abrams' usual standards. I found the most compelling character development to take place between Han and Leia. I also found that Abrams managed to imbue the movie with more than a sprinkling of the ironic humor that made the original three Star Wars movies so funny, easily surpassing what often seemed like forced humor in the three Star Wars prequels. The action, however, simply couldn't live up to the prequels, which featured what are still easily the two greatest live-action lightsaber duals in the Star Wars universe. I got the feeling that Abrams, who as I understand it grew up watching the original three, went out of his way to avoid his usual glaring plot holes and avoided going to the action extremes of the three prequels, to make The Force Awakens feel more like the original three. Perhaps nothing successfully evoked the feel of the original Star Wars movies better than Abrams' use of John Williams' score, both the old and the new∂?providing at appropriate points a sense of sorry and longing, a sense for foreboding, or a sense of excitement. I literally laughed and cried. The very last scene of the movie left me with a tear that ran all the way down my left cheek. The Force Awakens contained at least two major plot reveals, and set the stage for what I suspect might be an even more major plot reveal in Star Wars VIII: The Force Returns in 2017. While my favorite parts involved the original Star Wars cast members, I found Daisy Ridley a fresh, young talent as the new heroine, and John Boyega wasn't bad as Finn either. I'm not usually a big fan of 3D, but I thought Abrams made rare good use of it, like when a star destroyer suddenly appeared about to collide with my face. I'm having trouble deciding whether I like The Force Awakens any better than the three prequel movies. While I hated Jar Jar Binks, I never otherwise disliked the prequels the way that many fans did. If I had to guess about other fans, I'd say that more of them will rank The Force Awakens below the original three but above the prequel than any other ranking among fans.

title: A movie that touches the heart...
review: This is undoubtedly the best movie I have ever seen. The acting of the main protagonists - Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman - are brilliant. The movie is about hope and redemption. It is also about how uncertain life is - how circumstances can lead a person to disastrous consequences through no fault of his own.  Tim Robbin's portrayal of Andy Dufresne - a banker who is sent to jail for murdering his wife - was as natural as ever. Morgan Freeman as a seasoned convict Red who goes through a transformation during his time with Andy makes you feel for the man. Bob Gunton will make you hate the evil hypocritical warden with all your heart. Overall, everyone has done a beautiful job with their roles.  This film touched a special chord in my heart. I never tire of watching it. If you love the drama genre, this movie is for you.

title: One of a kind, Nolan's best work.
review: You won't have any trouble believing that aphorism when you see Heath Ledger's mesmerizing performance as the Joker in "The Dark Knight," Christopher Nolan's hotly anticipated and often brilliantly executed follow-up to "Batman Begins." His face caked in cracked white greasepaint, his smile a grotesque red lipstick scar, kohl rimming his eyes, the Joker is a cruel kind of clown, the kind that is only interested in the last laugh. Slouched in his purple suit, Ledger gives him a lopsided shuffle, a permanently craning neck and an insinuating, deceptively neighborly voice. But there's something reptilian about the way his tongue flicks through his pursed lips like a pickpocket. He's hungry for trouble, a maniac for mayhem -- and in Gotham City, where crime is still running wild, he can make himself right at home. Ledger dominates this movie as a living presence, a live wire, dangerous and unpredictable. It's an astonishing performance, as extravagant and free ("deranged" might be a better word) as his Ennis Del Mar in "Brokeback Mountain" was inhibited and tongue-tied. And "The Dark Knight" takes him -- and its world -- very seriously. Even more than Batman himself, the Joker would usually scream "camp" (and has in the TV series and other movies) but Nolan refuses to go there. His Gotham is cement and glass, a "real" city not so different from what we might find in any contemporary action thriller. (Chicago doubles for Batman's metropolis.)

title: A mesmerizing and spell binding conclusion to the greatest phenomenon of this decade.
review: A phenomenon which started 14 years ago ends with the last chapter in the Harry Potter Saga. The movie series, unlike the books, had its share of ups and downs. As a die hard Potterhead, I've always preferred the first two movies which remain the most faithful to the books. I really hated how this series had to face a change of directors in the middle, disrupting a continuous flow from the first two, but even though the third and the fourth ones had their differences from the book, yet they remained entertaining and magical. It wasn't until David Yates came that in my opinion that the series went downhill. With Yates helming the fifth and the sixth one, the Harry Potter movie saga was at its worst. Not only were those two dull and bland, Yates completely missed the essence of the books which the other directors were able to hold on to. When I came to know that David Yates was chosen for the finale, my worst fear had come true. I dreaded how Yates was going to butcher the finale of a great series which deserved a perfect send off. With the release of Deathly Hallows - Part 1, I was both concerned and relieved. Part 1 had its share of great moments but just like the previous two installments, something was missing, something magical which the first four in the series had. So from then onwards it was time to await for the finale and wonder if Part 2 would be what us fans expected it to be. Today, after watching Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 2 for the second time I can only say this, Harry Potter fans could not have asked for a better end to the series that has shaped their childhood for more than a decade. Everything about the movie was perfect. From the acting, which was the greatest amongst all the eight movies, especially from Daniel Radcliffe who had the whole movie on his shoulder to carry on and carries it off, he does brilliantly, from Ralph Fiennes who portrays a great villain with perfect menace and from Alan Rickman as Snape who gives us the highlight sequence of the series with such sincerity and grace that would make even a casual fan feel for him. Rupert Grint and Emma Watson though this time had to be sidelined a bit but still play their part beautifully with Emma showing why she's one of the brilliant actresses out there and Rupert who this time around brings out a more truer Ron than he had in the previous few installments. Not to mention the other actors like Maggie Smith who this time was given a deserving screen time and a role to play, Matthew Lewis who gives a terrific performance as the unsung Hero of Hogwarts and all the rest. If there was one thing Harry Potter got absolutely correct then that was the casting. Kudos to the filmmakers to achieve such a success with this! The direction this time around was outstanding. Always considered David Yates to be the worst thing that happened to Hogwarts but he has proved me wrong with a finale that puts him up there with the elite ones. Even though he butchered two installments but he created an outstanding finale which is his redemption. The music is one of the reasons why the movie works so well. Alexandre Desplat may have given a better than average music for Part 1 but with Part 2 he shows why he is an Oscar nominated composer. His battle tracks especially the Statues and Courtyard Apocalypse were brilliant and his Lilly and Severus along with the Resurrection Stone track hits all the right notes. Though his biggest contribution is the use of John William's Leaving Hogwarts for the epilogue which is the greatest service he could have given to the fans and works as a powerful tool to bring out a decade long emotion in the end. The visual effects as usual with the HP series were brilliant. The Battle of Hogwarts was breath taking, with beautiful cinematography. This movie had the right amount of violence and action keeping the battle intriguing and intense. A mesmerizing and spell binding conclusion to the greatest phenomenon of this decade. David Yates, by crafting a magical finale, you have truly demonstrated why Harry Potter is and will always be.... The Boy Who Lived...!!!

title: You don't need a million $ for a masterpiece, you just need the wits - 12 Angry Men delivers!
review: This movie is a classic proof of brilliant acting and witty storyline surpassing all the flashy frills of modern cinema. Even the James Bonds before 007 (ie. North by Northwest) used to spread around cash everywhere to make eye-candy thrillers, but behold! 12 Angry Men will prove otherwise. If you want a witty movie, feel smart (by being a person to have watched a Black n White film and brag about it the next day) AND enjoy AMAZING entertainment at the same time - then this is a MUST WATCH! Thus, its not only "highly recommended" but a "MUST SEE." 10/10

title: great movie
review: a great movie from the one of the best selling novels ever.ending was too sorrow for me but the theme tune was beyond imaginable.once you get the hang of it,you will be an addict to lord of the rings.I am now also watching the hobbit being inspired by it.hope that every one also likes it like I did.again you should keep your schedule because this movie is of 3 hours.But when you like it you would not move an inch from your seat without watching it totally.this movie won 11 Oscars and it deserves that.frodo baggins is now one of my movie favorite characters and all the characters are just wonderful see.From the fellowship to the mount doom each phase had a different theme to it and we can say after watching the movie the IMDb ratings should have been even higher.

title: Great on so many levels, yet if falls short
review: I am a huge fan of Miller's comics and really dislike Rodriguez's films. The hype surrounding this movie was huge and as of today the movie is in IMDb top 100. But at the same time, so are Kill Bill and Kill Bill 2, two movies that I disliked with passion. So I didn't really know what to expect from Sin City. Unfortunately I walked out of Sin City with mixed reviews. First the good The attention to detail that went to transferring the comic book into movie is amazing. Backgrounds look exactly the same as they do in the comics, and to give the movie another dimension, many features, such as rain and scenes that show characters all white against black background, have comic book look to it. This movie take the technology introduced in Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow to a whole new level. Mickey Rourke is amazing as tough-as-nail Marv. Perfectly cast, perfectly played out part. Elijah Wood creates perfect Kevin. I get the chills while reading the comic every time Kevin shows up. Movie is no different. Devon Aoki and Rosario Dawson do excellent job as well. The bad So many actors are not suited for their roles. Bruce Willis does not suit almost 70 year old Hartigan. Clive Owen, Benicio Del Toro, Jessica Alba, Brittany Murphy, Joshua Hartnett all are playing parts not suited for them. The inner monologue that each character work brilliantly in the comic, but for some reason looks ridiculous in the movie. Each character thinks as if they are all read Wall Street Journal and watch private eye flicks from 40's. Sometimes the end result is simply laughable. The scene when Clive Owen is being pulled out from the lake by Devon Aoki is a perfect example of that. Finally, when characters do talk, it is always as if the words are being forced out of them, always ending with a big sigh. Overall, I don't think the movie deserves to be in the top 250 of all time, let alone top 100. It is solid, but not great, and definitely not deserving all the hype it got so far.

title: Didn't like it much!
review: Bought the DVD few days back. Started to watch on last weekend with great expectations. But i got very much disappointed. It was totally boring. the story seemed quite unrealistic to me. the only thing to watch was acting of the villain of the movie. I'm really not sure how it got such a high rating by IMDb users. The story telling was too slow. I thought there there were too many unnecessary scenes. The character "Anton Chigurh" has been shown too much powerful to be true. All together, i got so dis-hearted with this movie that I couldn't help myself but write a bad review about this movie, which happens to be my first ever written movie review anywhere.

title: Quentin Tarantino's best next to Pulp Fiction and a good tribute to not only western films, but the directors who mentor Quentin.
review: This movie to me is one of the best movies of 2012 and Quentin Tarantino's best movie that is great as his other masterpiece Pulp Fiction. The story is about a slave Jango (the "D" is silent) played by Jamie Foxx rescued by a bounty hunter (played by Quentin Tarantino's lucky acting cram Christoph Waltz in another best acting role of his). They soon become partners in the bounty hunting bushiness and plan to rescue Django's wife held as a slave by the villainous Leonardo DiCaprio (in a great role of his career) and the evil and sneaky Samuel L. Jackson (who turns out is the real brains behind this slave ring). The action is great and pretty funny like most Quentin's films and it is not only a great tribute to Spaghetti Westerns by Quentin, but to me a great tribute to the two directors who help Mr. Tarantino make his first movie Tony Scott and Ulu Grosbard who died on the year of this film's release before it came out. I notice the tributes to them in this film more than other people did. For Ulu Grosbard, Quentin pay tributes to his films such as True Confessions (the partnership with Dr. King Schultz and Django), Falling in Love (Django and his wife's romance), The Deep End of the Ocean (Broomhilda surprised to have finally meet Django again) and Who Is Harry Kellerman and Why Is He Saying Those Terrible Things About Me? (in scenes including Jamie Foxx in a snow hill scene in the same way as Dustin Hoffman in the movie). For Tony Scott, it was mostly the action scenes (especially the big battle in Candy Land) are tributes to his films True Romance, Enemy of the State, The Last Boy Scout and Domino. What should of make the film better is that the credits should of have "Dedicated to Ulu and Tony" the same as Clint Eastwood dedicated Unforgiven to Sergio Leone and Don Siegel. But along with "In Memory of Sally Menke and J. Michael Riva". That was the only thing that I criticize the movie about is Quentin should of dedicated his movie to Tony Scott, Ulu Grosbard, Sally Menke and J. Michael Riva who died before the film was release. Over all, this is still a great movie and very good tributes to Western and Tony Scott and Ulu Grosbard. I say its worth checking out, if you love colorful funny bloody action and Quentin films you will love it. Its funny, action packed, original and has good acting and action.

title: Best movie since Schindler's List and the slave version of it.
review: Just saw it last week and was really powerful and a masterpiece as Schindler's List. The story is haunting and makes you feel you are in that time period. I really want this win Best Picture for the 86th Academy Awards and also win for Best Director Steve McQueen and have him become the first black director to win Best Director. Why? The acting from the main character is amazing, as well as Michael Fassbender who plays a crazy religious drunk slave owner and is become one of the best actors of the 21st century. The direction by Steve McQueen is gold and the best I have seen since Steven Spilberge for Saving Pravite Ryan and again Schindler's List and Tom Hooper for The King's Speech. The other stuff that I like was the music score by Hans Zimmer while although it feels the same as he did Inception, it is haunting and powerful as his scores to The Thin Red Line and Galdiator. The script by Undercover Brother's John Ridley which is pure gold and some of the art and costumes as well. If you are looking for a good movie that goes with Schindler's List and Grave of the Firefiles. This is a masterpiece to go see and put in that collection.

title: This movie is the best out of 8 movies in this series
review: I've just watched this movie in the cinema. So, my mark for it will be 10 of 10. But honestly, I don't really like the way they change the final duel between Harry and Voldemort as well as the way Harry won. It's not logic at all comparing to the book's events. The creativity in the Hogwarts battle is good, but still it cannot provide the super surprising, astonishing and logical explanations for everything has happened from the start to the last moments. 3D effects are good, but not as good as in Avatar. Anyway, it's still the best out of 8 movies in this series. I'm gonna miss this wizard world so much for many years. J. K. Rowling is really the BEST!

title: What a film
review: One of the most powerful and sad tales of the movies history. The little boy character is awesome. My favorite film with "El Verdugo". The best way to see this film is in Italian language. For me (I'm from Spain) the Italian language is easy to understand. I've got too the Spanish version but the final is different cause there are a voice in off that give us a better end and hope for the future. This is not like the original film. The original is harder and better. This is the post war in Italy and is not a easy film to see cause the European way of life after the second world war was very hard for all people. I recommend this film for all the young people that today have all thing they want.

title: This movie will impact your brain
review: yes, i like directors who can play with your brain in ways that you can never imagine, this happens clearly in this excellent movie, with a story that no one could imagine how will develop, and with a notable performance by the leading actor. I did not know much about Korean cinema, but after seen this movie I think that I will put more attention to the films that are coming from that country. The art direction is also unusual for films like one would consider to be horror ones, but that is not the case for old boy, it has a lot of art in its darkness exploration of human soul. a really must see movie. don't miss it if you like new approaches to cinema.

title: Too good but too long
review: Last night i went with my friends to our local cinema, to watch "Django Unchained", which we were waiting to get out since it was first announced. So, after we purchased our tickets, but for some reason we got late into the screening room and got bad seats, at the right side of the screen (usually we get in the room first and get seats at the center). So, the film finally starts, we lay back with high hopes as the movie trailers go through, and, finally, Django is on. I can honestly say that i was expecting a little bit of professional directing from Quentin, as the first scenes of the film were not shot as professionally as they should be. But, nevertheless, its Quentin Tarantino, so i respect the way he wanted it to be. Watching it, i have to say that the film was an n-word warfare, while raining blood and guts.. I enjoy gore in films, but i think there was more than enough blood when a person was shot. I mean, people got shot and blood fountains came out of their wounds..! The film was extremely violent, people getting eaten by dogs, blowing heads and torturing slaves.. Had a very good story line, excellent performances but, honestly, it was TOO long. Anyway, its a very nice film, i recommend it to anyone looking for a high quality movie. My ratings are: Acting: 9/10 Runtime: 7/10 Violence/Gore: 10/10 Sex/nudity: 6/10 Profanity: 10/10 Plot: 9/10 Scenery (landscapes): 10/10 Directing: 8/10

title: The Shawshank Redemption (1994)
review: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency. This is the highest film based upon movie reviews here on IMDb with a 9.3 out of 10 beating The Dark Knight, Terminator 2 and Aliens. The reason why i loved this movie is the elements it's trying to reach for example friendship between all the inmates, corruption of the warden who i enjoyed watching him die and of course redemption for Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. The acting is excellent, the direction is pretty great and the story is also great a movie that never looses hope made by a very talented director Frank Darabont. Although the 9.3 rating is a bit way too much i mean i enjoyed all the movies i listed on this review a bit more including Godfather. This movie definitely belongs on the Top 250 movies of all time just not number 1 maybe in place number 10 or 15 maybe? Anyways this movie is great if you haven't seen it check it out i give it a A- and a 8.5/10

title: A Classic Masterpiece.
review: The Godfather Has One Of The Best Performance Ever By Marlon Brando and Al Pacino there's a reason why this film has a 9.2 on IMDb because it's amazing one of the best movies ever made. Great Cast, Great Director and Great Dialogue the film remains on the top after so many years. The Father and Son relationship grows more as the film continues and there's a lot of character development the rest of the cast does a great job as well Talia Shire, James Caan and Robert Duvall if people love this kind of movies with Gangsters and great acting then The Godfather is the right movie for you and still the best in The Godfather Trilogy. Final Verdict: 10 out of 10

title: A Great Sequel but the Original is Better!!!
review: The Godfather Part II is great and full of great performances from Al Pacino, Robert Duvall and Robert De Niro but it's not as great as the first film you might kinda get bored at times because is too slow but as a film is truly amazing the film takes place in both the 1920s and 1958 De Niro plays the character that Marlo Brando played in the first film but in a younger age. But like i said it's still a great movie sequel but it is not better than the first film and it's a little bit overrated as a film but it's still awesome and it deserves the credit it gets for it's awesome Acting and Direction. The GodFather Part II is a 9 out of 10.

title: It's Simple We Kill The Batman...
review: The Dark Knight is the 2nd film in the Dark Knight Trilogy directed by Christopher Nolan starring Christian Bale as Batman and the late Heath Ledger as the Joker. In this film Batman goes against his deadliest enemy ever the Joker this and the Patriot has the best Acting moments of Heath Ledger. Even if it's great as Batman Begins it's a little bit overrated at times but we all can understand why these 3 films are already considered Classics because they're Awesome and they are directed by a really great director. If you are a fan of Nolan and his work and the great DC hero then you're going to love The Dark Knight. Why So Serious?

title: Return of the King
review: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring. Easily the best of the 3 The Return of the King is 3 hour action packed spectacle and an emotional ride with it'sending the story comes into a full circle and it's very easy to see why and just like The Dark Knight Trilogy and Star Wars Trilogy this one also gets in that list with the best Trilogies of all time and i gotta say the best character out of both LOTR and the Hobbit movies for me was Legolas alongside Aragorn and Legolas alongside Bilbo they easily have the best scenes and it's all thanks to Peter Jackson.

title: Overrated!!
review: Saw this film a couple of months ago it was boring and crap both Pitt and Norton are ridiculous the so called action scenes are brutal but stupid and the dialogue is so funny and let's not forget Man tits. And It gets even worse with the ending i wish David Fincher makes a film that is worth it maybe a sequel to The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo would be fine since that is his only good film that i can remember. Most people will enjoy this movie because it's crazy and it's directed by Fincher but we can't all have the same opinion this movie is overrated and it deserves lower than a 8.9 for sure. A 3/10 for me it was boring and stupid!!

title: LoTr (2001)
review: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle Earth from the Dark Lord Sauron. Although this isn't the best of the LOTR Films it's for sure the most beautiful one since we meet each and every character in a really good way, i loved all the characters and each of them had their moment and even the villains were really great for example that moment in the river was filmed really good and they stick with the books and the characters and that's always a good think also Peter Jackson is a fantastic director and that shows up. And after all those years it still has an impact on everyone!!

title: My Favorite in the Original Trilogy.
review: Star Wars Episode V: Empire Strikes Back is one of the little times when the sequel is 8 times better than the Original and in this case this movie does it very well. Lightsaber battles, Han Solo, Humor and most of all Action is easy to see why so many people love Episode 5 the most since it is actually the best one it has a great story, cool direction and an awesome cast. I'm still surprised that the man who made the best Star Wars movie made the weakest Robocop film ever made it's really sad. At the end i had way too much fun with this film and it's full of classic lines like "Luke i am your Father" and "I Love you, I Know" it doesn't get any better than this.

title: Run, Forrest! Run!
review: Forrest Gump, while not intelligent, has accidentally been present at many historic moments, but his true love, Jenny Curran, eludes him. Forrest Gump is a film that the first time i saw it i didn't like it that much but right now after seeing it again i absolutely loved but the film comes out with flaws not in acting or direction mostly it's the characters for example this is a 2 hours film and Jenny kinda pisses me off i get it she was abused as a child by her father it makes sense but what doesn't make sense is her spending time and traveling around with men who hit her and abuse her as well and when Forrest attacks 2 guys and goes nuts she acts normal we spend 142 minutes in this movie of seeing her playing a guitar naked, dating a bunch of a**holes and leaving Forrest every 2 or 3 years alone and when she returns she leaves again tell me where the message is on that? I don't hate Jenny she brought me the feels in the end with her story what i hate is the way the director uses her character and i hate that. Another problem i had was the way everyone treated Forrest calling him dumb and idiot like every 30 minutes this film as a whole is very hard to watch to be honest just for the way everyone doubted him even those girls when they called him stupid and Dan Taylor pushed her away and he fall over his wheelchair and those chicks made fun of him it was painful. But besides that this film is truly a cinematic treasure with Tom Hanks giving one of the finest performances of his entire life and also inspiring people and even meeting famous presidents or singers like Elvis and John Lennon (they did a pretty good job with those scenes by the way) or even the promise he gave to his dear friend Bubba Blue and it's so sad seeing a very young Haley Joel Osment as Forrest Junior he was very talented but once again Hollywood ruined another young kid. As for my favorite moment in the entire film it has to be when Forrest find out about his son and the first thing he asks is if he is smart that scene destroyed me completely. Forrest Gump deserves all the praise it gets but like i said characters like Jenny should and could be handled much much better.

title: The 2 Towers
review: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard. Most of the time sequels suck but not this one this easily a step up than the first film which was also fantastic but this one did somethings better for example the scenes with the trees in the forest or the battle sequences and smigol continues to steal the show Andy Serkis is a fantastic actor and he can play any character that you want also the cgi on Smigol is fantastic he looks very real and you feel like he is going to talk to you so that's another great thing about those movies.

title: One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest (1975)
review: A criminal pleads insanity after getting into trouble again and once in the mental institution rebels against the oppressive nurse and rallies up the scared patients. Based upon an excellent performance by legendary actor Jack Nicholson One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest is just a touching but also a great pack of performances by Danny DeVito, Christopher Lloyd and Louise Fletcher this is a very touching movie that will totally move you and affect you but also the ending which i kinda hated it it's the redemption of Nicholson's character since he has been threw all this things and you totally get it. If you haven't seen this masterpiece please do easily one of the best movies ever made but also a great performance by Jack Nicholson.

title: Great Mob Film!!!
review: Henry Hill and his friends work their way up through the mob hierarchy. GoodFellas is one of those movies that you see and think what the hell happened to Robert De Niro and Ray Liotta why do they make crappy movies this days? The thing is all about money but back then art was real for example Joe Pesci in this film alongside Liotta and De Niro are excellent great actors and characters with a lot of power and charisma even Samuel L. Jackson has a small role before he gets wasted. A lot of violence, corruption, bloodbath and men with a lot of power and money unfortunately tho this movie is not better than the amazing Casino also directed by Scorsese or even The Godfather Trilogy but still a really good directed movie with really good acting and a very interesting story and that's why i'll give it a 8.5/10.

title: The Matrix
review: The 90's had a a lot of great movies Total Recall, Terminator 2, Heat, Die Hard with a Vengeance but we also had a lot of crap like Batman & Robin. The Matrix is in the list with the great movies and here's why the movie has a good cast and even tho the film is some kind of a Terminator rip-off some times especially the 3rd one it's a cool movie with a cool soundtrack and some of the most memorable action sequences or villains like Mr. Smith or the slow motion scene of Neo with the bullets. It's sad that the film had 2 sequels that people hated and so did the critics except the 2nd one. The Matrix is one of the best films ever made and you can totally see why.

title: A Classic Masterpiece!!!
review: I wasn't a big Star Wars fan when i was younger but i watched the films last year and i became a fan in a second and since The Force Awakens gets released in my country in 5 days i decided to re-watch the Original Trilogy which i love the most as every Star Wars fan does. A New Hope is the film that started the magic of the Saga even tho is not as great as the sequel that came after it Episode IV is definitely awesome from the beautiful cast to the good writing and direction. Too bad that George Lucas had to change some of the most awesome scenes in a cut that has way too much CGI and for the record Han Shot First. At the end Star Wars: A New Hope is a great film that created one of the most beautiful Franchises of all time.

title: Strong Ending Boring Film!!
review: Se7en is not a bad movie but it's a big let down except the performance of Kevin Spacey and that ending there's nothing more good about it. The jokes that the characters try to throw in some of the scenes are just awful and for sure not funny Brad Pitt and Morgan Freeman can't save the film that David Fincher (Alien3) directed the cast is good the acting is meh except Spacey and the ending is a huge WTF that shows that the Bad guys can truly win other than that Se7en is a 2 hour film that is boring to the bone if you want to see a great serial killer film go watch Zodiac that is one hell of a film. Final Verdict 5 out of 10 nothing more nothing less.

title: Really great horror film with flaws..
review: A young F.B.I. cadet must confide in an incarcerated and manipulative killer to receive his help on catching another serial killer who skins his victims. Silence of the Lambs is a film that i have a very tough time to enjoy and in a scale of 1 to 10 it's definitely an 8 i just wish that the film had a more interesting villain than Buffalo Bill and don't get me wrong Ted Levine did a nice job with his character it's just that moments like that scene where he dances butt naked and acts like a woman were stupid as hell and that girl Catherine was annoying as hell she never stopped screaming. Anthony Hopkins gives an amazing performance in the film and there's a scene in particular which i loved it's the scene where he is in the ambulance and we find out that he actually stole the face of the guard in order to escape that was a very clever scene there's also a scene where he basically crucified the other guard and his scenes with Jodie Foster who was also very good in the film too were magnificent. Guys in the end Silence of the Lambs is a really good film with 2 great leading performances, a weak villain who is overrated and almost ruins the whole movie but also a victim that gets annoying after a while i'm going to give the film an 8/10.

title: Terrific
review: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat, which begin when five criminals meet at a seemingly random police lineup. Don't get me wrong X-Men, X-Men Apocalypse and X- Men 2 are amazing but between this and Days of Future Past i would definitely choose this especially that ending was truly shocking as we get to see who the real villain is and it was pretty clever what they did with that. The cast is truly great especially Spacey and Byrne and Bryan Singer directs a movie very well shot and directed and i wasn't disappointed not even for a second and i would definitely watch this again without a doubt. The Usual Suspects gets an 10 out of 10 of course.

title: Leon (1994)
review: Mathilda, a 12-year-old girl, is reluctantly taken in by L«∏on, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. L«∏on and Mathilda form an unusual relationship, as she becomes his prot«∏g«∏e and learns the assassin's trade. Leon is one of those Luc Besson movies that they were just excellent thanks to Jean Reno and Natalie Portman this movie is just a must see for everyone is funny, action packed and dramatic and has probably the best child performance of the 90's unfortunately it has flaws too my biggest problem were the last 15 minutes where the movie gets over the top with Gary Oldman sending 200 people to get one guy and his character is also very over the top threw out the whole movie and that's a bummer cause he is a pretty good actor but besides that it's still a pretty cool movie and i'll give it a A-

title: In the list with the best War Films of all Time!!!
review: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action. Saving Private Ryan is one of the many great films Steven Spielberg has directed it's violent, very well shot and it has a very touching ending that really affected me and Tom Hanks is just superb like always of course and even when the film kinda slows down from the whole war thing in order to work on it's characters even then it works because you have a good cast and some pretty cool characters that you desperately want to know more and more and for sure it won't disappoint you.

title: Genius!!
review: Phoenix office worker Marion Crane is fed up with the way life has treated her. She has to meet her lover Sam in lunch breaks and they cannot get married because Sam has to give most of his money away in alimony. One Friday Marion is trusted to bank $40,000 by her employer. Seeing the opportunity to take the money and start a new life, Marion leaves town and heads towards Sam's California store. Tired after the long drive and caught in a storm, she gets off the main highway and pulls into The Bates Motel. The motel is managed by a quiet young man called Norman who seems to be dominated by his mother. Thanks to a magnificent performance by Anthony Perkins and a great director such as Alfred Hitchcock Psycho turns out to be a classic movie that nobody seems to understand why and they never will the story is simple but the way it's directed but also the time it came out it's truly remarkable now the movie does have issues mostly it's pacing which is slow but not boring you want to know more about Bates but also about the plot especially with the ending you will learn everything you need to know about him and his 2 personalities also i did expected much more but i got a creepy soundtrack and 2 awesome and goofy kills for the time but even tho the way he stabs her seems like it never touched her it still worked because you have a mastermind behind the camera if the film was made today there would be a tone of blood cgi mostly and of course the last shot of Bates is what i would call creepy as hell. Is this a movie i would watch again? I might is this a film i would buy? i don't know but still a very very good movie and i give it an 8 out of 10.

title: Funny and Full of Action..
review: The Indiana Jones Series started with this one and who can forget that moment when Indy runs like crazy from that big ball it's just a Classic Moment. Also Harrison Ford as Indiana Jones is priceless it's what a perfect casting looks like he lives the character and brings him to life in a big way let's not forget that Indy also shot first if you know what i mean. Definitely a movie that you need to check if you haven't seen it from the Golden Era of the 80's and definitely on the list with Steven Spielberg's best movies. Although i do think that The Temple Of Doom was much much better but still a Classic and Great Movie.

title: Perfection!!!
review: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift. The Green Mile is a beautiful movie not just for it's visuals, acting and direction but the story the story is what keeps people entertained but also Michael Clarke Duncan rest his soul he is so great in the movie the ending always makes me cry and the film has such a powerful message like an angel came down to earth in order to help some sick people like Tom Hanks for instance. When they all started crying when they executed him it was such beautiful and sad if you like Tom Hanks and this certain kind of movies The Green Mile is a must see.

title: A Great Sequel but...
review: Many people will say that the story ends with T2 i disagree on that Terminator 2 is a great movie sequel with an amazing cast, awesome effects, great Soundtrack and the saddest Ending in a film ever made. It works as a sequel and it was made by a great Director it's a shame that James Cameron left these movies in order to make Titanic and Avatar. But even without his direction those films still remain great and awesome. Anyways T2 is a great sequel and for sure it's not Overrated but the way it was directed it just made every sequel impossible because it has a perfect direction. T2: Judgment Day remains a great movie with powerful performances by Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton and Robert Patrick and it's still an amazing movie. 10 out of 10 for me.

title: The Departed (2006)
review: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston. Jack Nicholson gives an amazing performance at times scare the living crap out of you and others making you laugh, Leonardo DiCaprio was also great and Matt Damon was also good. There's a lot of violence and F words but the movie works just for that you have a great cast, lines and it's directed by Martin Scorsese. My only problem with the film was the 3rd act and the ending where everyone started killing each other you know all 3 main actors from the poster died especially DiCaprio's death was like "What The?" but i liked the way Damon was killed that was really nice to see but still great Crime movie.

title: J.K Simmons enough said...
review: Saw Whiplash in theaters in the beginning of January and i was blown away from the performances of Miles Teller and J.K Simmons both men gave 2 fantastic performances in their roles and they both steal the show. Also stars Paul Reiser (Aliens) and Melissa Benoist (Supergirl). Fletcher is the perfect bad teacher his one liners were awesome and he wouldn't stop until he reached Andrew into a point that he was going to say enough which you will actually see in the end this movie is insane and crazy but in a very good way i was surprised by the performances and the the film it self it definitely deserves your time. Final Rating: 10 out of 10.

title: What We Do In Life Echoes In Eternity.
review: When a Roman general is betrayed and his family murdered by an emperor's corrupt son, he comes to Rome as a gladiator to seek revenge. Ridley Scott has directed some pretty great movies threw out the years The Martian, Alien and now Gladiator and although this movie was made in 2000 it still holds up to this day it's nice edited and very well shot and has some great performances Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Connie Nielsen, Djimon Hounsou and Ralf Moeller and what always made the film so good for me was the character of Maximus played by Crowe he is a fighter with nothing left to loose and even when his end comes he accepts it and he finally knows that he will see his Family again and damn that got me. Gladiator is just an action packed, Adventure, Drama that succeeds in every level you want to.

title: A Classic Sci-Fi Masterpiece
review: With an impressive cast of talented actors and an amazing director it's easy to say that Alien is a classic even if it's slow as a film and has only one Alien in the entire film it still has you on the edge of your seat it's a well made masterpiece with great performances by everyone especially Sigourney Weaver as Ripley this was the time when films were actually awesome another great thing about the movie is the practical effects and the costume is really great the Alien skull is kinda stupid tho but still cool. Alien is like The Terminator it started as horror and then went to action, if you like Sci-Fi you gonna love this movie. 9 out of 10.

title: Classic Western
review: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner. Django Unchained is easily the most entertaining film of Quentin Tarantino since Kill Bill Part 2. The characters are amazing, the acting is superb and the cinematography is great as well with beautiful shots and a lot of violence alongside classic action that pays tribute to old classic western movies Django Unchained is easily a terrific film that shows that Tarantino can achieve greatness when he is trying to at least. Jamie Foxx, Leonardo DiCaprio and Christoph Waltz are just magnificent and that is why Django: Unchained gets a 10 out of 10 and a A+

title: Here's Johnny!!
review: Probably the most creepiest movie ever made the direction is great and Jack Nicholson owns the role a terrific actor. As the movie goes on you get to see what happens the characters start to change especially Nicholson as days and months go by he goes more insane the same goes for his son the only complaiment i had about this film was his wife she was a little bit annoying and stupid but still she was OK. And it doesn't matter how many years will go by this film will have one of the most strangest endings in movie history so mysterious and the way Jack died funny as hell but still a great horror movie and so creepy. An underrated classic and a straight 10.

title: It Ends Here...
review: The Dark Knight Rises is the last Batman movie in the Nolan Universe Starring Christian Bale as Batman, Tom Hardy as Bane and Anne Hathaway as Catwoman. Even if some people thought this film is kinda boring and Batman is really weak and Bane is really annoying i thought it was good. This is the only time that Tom Hardy is actually good in something but i have to agree his voice is kinda annoying but the conclusion to the Dark Knight Trilogy is pretty Epic and many people will always wonder did Batman died or did he survived? Anyways the Final Batman movie is as great as the last two films the only thing we can do now is to wait for Batman to fight Superman next year.

title: Best Movie Sequel Ever Made.
review: Aliens is one of those films that is better than the Original and is directed by James Cameron and Starring Sigourney Weaver, Michael Biehn, Lance Henrisken and Bill Paxton. 2nd best Film of Cameron after The Terminator great performances, great one-liners, great practical effects and great directing. This is the first movie that we get to see the Alien Queen at her full glory she is a badass and she is dangerous. I don't think anyone can say anything bad about this film it's obviously 10 times better than the first one even if the first one was awesome this is even more awesome for me this movie is better than both Avatar and Titanic a terrific masterpiece from James Cameron. A 10 out of 10!!

title: Awesometacular!!
review: Episode VI is my 2nd favorite in the series because it really shows how awesome and kind Darth Vader truly was he had to pick between 2 things either he would left his son die or stay with the Emperor forever and thank god he chose the first one and yes Luke was indeed right because there was still good inside him and their battle was epic in so many ways. As much as i loved New Hope i think Return of the Jedi was better just for those minutes alone because he truly showed a beautiful side of Anakin Skywalker something that the prequels didn't. Star Wars VI isn't getting enough credit for me and that is pretty bad i think all 3 films are awesome on their own way although this one has the most humor in it and i think those little creatures were pretty cool and cute and definitely not as annoying as some people said we can always have Jar Jar Binks for that. Anyways if you loved Episode IV & V you will definitely love Return of the Jedi.

title: Best of Mel Gibson.
review: Braveheart is fiction sure we know that but is just epic from the soundtrack to the battle scenes Gibson directs himself in a very amazing film with great performances. I liked the characters, i liked the love stories i liked the gore not everything you see in this film actually happened but still it's an amazing movie and one of Mel Gibson's best films for sure. If you love historical films like this you're going to love this movie it's amazing from the performances to the battles to the drama and beyond. They may take our lives. But they'll never take our FREEDOM. One of the best movies ever made. 10 out of 10!!!!

title: It should end there...
review: I can't believe that they are making a Toy Story 4 even if i love this series i just think Toy Story 3 should be the end it ended so heart broken and so great it just closes the story forever but as always Hollywood finds more things to do. Anyways Toy Story 3 is amazing a true masterpiece it has so many laughs and some very sad moments especially when they start holding hands don't tell me that you didn't cry in there or when Andy left Woody that was such a great moment right in the feels. One of my all time favorites if you loved the previous 2 films you're going to love this one also it's just great. A 10 out of 10.

title: Overrated!!
review: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a procedure to have each other erased from their memories. But it is only through the process of loss that they discover what they had to begin with. Kate Winslet and Jim Carrey are both great actors unfortunately the film is just awful and makes no sense at all and it's pretty overrated Jim Carrey was great in The Mask and Dumb & Dumber but in here he is just sad films like this and Se7en, Gone Girl and Fight Club are just some of the many overrated dumb and overrated films that Hollywood is making every goddamn day and the critics try to push as some amazing masterpiece that they were simply weren't and this is one of them too.

title: The Beginning of a Classic Trilogy.
review: Toy Story came out on 1995 and it got 2 more sequels Toy Story 2 and Toy Story 3. Story: Woody, a traditional pull-string talking cowboy, has long enjoyed a place of honor as the favorite among six-year-old Andy's menagerie of toys. Quick to calm their anxieties about being replaced by newer arrivals, Woody finds his own confidence shaken, and his status as top toy in jeopardy, upon the arrival of Buzz Lightyear, simply the coolest space action figure ever made. Woody plots to get rid of Buzz, but things backfire and he finds himself lost in the outside world with Buzz as his only companion. Joining forces to find their way home, the two rivals set out on an adventure that lands them in the clutches of Sid, a sadistic neighborhood kid who is notorious for dismembering and reassembling "mutant" toys in his bedroom. As "guests" of Sid and his dog, Scud, the two fugitive toys forge a genuine friendship and learn that only through mutual trust and respect do they have any chance of survival. Toy Story is one of the best animation movies ever made full of laughs and drama with a great cast voicing the stars and a great script and direction it's easy to say that Toy Story is still one of the best movies ever made and for sure a Classic.

title: Great Crime Movie!!!
review: 1950's Los Angeles is the seedy backdrop for this intricate noir-ish tale of police corruption and Hollywood sleaze. Three very different cops are all after the truth, each in their own style: Ed Exley, the golden boy of the police force, willing to do almost anything to get ahead, except sell out; Bud White, ready to break the rules to seek justice, but barely able to keep his raging violence under control; and Jack Vincennes, always looking for celebrity and a quick buck until his conscience drives him to join Exley and White down the one-way path to find the truth behind the dark world of L.A. crime. Great direction, characters and story by everyone L.A Confidential succeeds both in action and drama.

title: Say Hello To My little Friend!!!!!
review: I remember watching this for the first time and i was blown away the way it's filmed and the way the actors live up to the characters i think it's brilliant. Al Pacino is great in anything you put him he is the perfect Tony Montana and you even have a young Michelle Pfeiffer (Catwoman from Batman Returns). And the most crazy part is that this mo vie is a remake and for the first time ever the Remake is way better than the Original and that final scene in his house when he is shooting everybody is amazing the end tho was kinda sad a lot but still a very good movie i'm glad i got it on DVD. Final Rating 10 out of 10 just for Al Pacino's Amazing Performance.

title: Don't Call Me Junior...
review: Now there's a 3rd sequel that doesn't suck i'm talking about Indiana Jones and The Last Crusade. Harrison Ford returns as Indy in order to save his father from the Nazis. Although i don't think it was as good as the previous film i still think this is a very great sequel. It's Directed by Steven Spielberg and has former a James Bond as the father of Han Solo and if that didn't make you excited yet i have news for ya this one also has flashbacks of a young Indiana Jones trying to steal the holy grail and bring it to it's rightful owners. There's one more sequel to review here and if i find the time i will try to review it tomorrow. The Last Crusade is definitely a 10 out of 10.

title: Excellent Writing!!!
review: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life. Good Will Hunting became a thing because 2 friends wrote the script called Ben Affleck and Matt Damon and they also star in the damn thing alongside Robin Williams and the entire cast are excellent. That "It's not your fault" scene brought tears to my eyes and the ending was there to show you how real friends look like they smiled not because he left but because he left to do something better with his life instead of actually working for 20 years at the same place. Also although there's so many F Words the film works because it's great. There's a reason why this film has a 8.3 here on IMDb that reason is called Damon, Affleck and Williams think about it.

title: Best Reboot Of All Time!!!
review: After his death back in 1997 in the hands of Joel Schumacher Batman returns in the 2005 reboot directed by Christopher Nolan starring Christian Bale as Batman which is the best casting ever since 1992. Begins has a great cast, great story and also is the Best Batman since Forever and Batman has never been more Badass than this those fight scenes with Liam Neeson were pretty EPIC. Go watch the film and make sure you play the Game as well which is pretty awesome as the film. Batman Begins is one of those times that Reboots can actually be as badass or even better than the Original. Batman is Back and better than ever!!!

title: Boxing at it's Finest!!
review: An emotionally self-destructive boxer's journey through life, as the violence and temper that leads him to the top in the ring destroys his life outside it. Raging Bull for me is in the same league as the Rocky Movies full of great performances and cinematography but also a scary looking De Niro that his face changes as the year go by but is the movie better than Rocky? Not even close unfortunately you see Rocky wasn't a bad guy he was a good guy trying to survive in the streets of Philadelphia and he inspired people but Jake La Motta (Robert De Niro) was a cold son of a b*tch that he destroyed his life by his own actions and that is why this movie is so great and it's really hard to make a great Boxing movie this days because films like Raging Bull and Rocky are really hard to get made again.

title: Great Movie
review: Just re-watched Die Hard last night and it's still great after all this years but if i had to pick against this movie and Predator i choose Predator it had even more one liners and even more gore. Alan Rickman is great as a villain and Bruce Willis is great as John McClane the movie was meant to be a sequel to Commando (1985) with Arnold Schwarzenegger but they actually changed it. Anyways i think it has great action, great characters and way over the top one liners and the gore was great too. I still like it as a movie but i think Die Hard 3 and Die Hard 4.0 were much better. I give it a 9 out of 10 a really great 80's action film.

title: Heat (1995)
review: A group of professional bank robbers start to feel the heat from police when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist. Heat is a 1995 action, crime and drama starring Robert De Niro, Al Pacino, Val Kilmer, Jon Voight, Tom Sizemore, Ashley Judd, Wes Studi, Tom Noonan, William Fichtner and Natalie Portman. The first time i saw this film i was blown away great performances by 2 giants of Cinema, great action, suspense and the screen time that Pacino and De Niro share together is like 5 minutes and it's so great especially the ending is just amazing in every way and that goes to Michael Mann he brought this 2 great actors and the result was truly epic and it's so sad that their next movie was going to be a bomb i'm talking about the 2008 Righteous KilL starring Pacino and De Niro again together and the result was just not that great.

title: Inside Out (2015)
review: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school. With a great sense of humor, action, characters and direction Inside Out focuses around a girl and her emotions that control her each moment of her life but when something goes wrong they try to rebuilt the somewhat Emotion machine. Easily the best and most touching scene in the whole film is the Bing Bong sacrifice the feels flow threw me. If you haven't seen Inside Out please do it's touching, funny and has great funny characters that will totally win you over trust me it's just a magic film.

title: Rocky start gets amazing after it..
review: A young boy is raised within the confines of a small shed. Room is one of those movies that i almost hated it the first 20 or maybe 25 minutes or so bored me to death and seeing a boy with long hair looking like a girl truly made me laugh but as the film goes on i found out that it's actually pretty great seeing this mother played by Brie Larson doing everything in her power to save her kid Jack played by Jacob Tremblay was really inspiring in a way and if you erase those 20-25 minutes the film is really great the performances by the 2 leads are really great and it's a powerful story as well but also the characters are well written and interesting and that's why i'm going to give the Room an 8/10.

title: Great Movie but it lacks on action and suspense..
review: Even tho Blade Runner rocks when it comes to action and suspense it fells short and Deckard (Harrison Ford) pretty much gets his butt kicked by almost everyone and he kills them only with guns. But the good thing about this film is that it's so ahead of it's time and so awesome when it comes to practical effects and locations todays movies can't even reach greatness like this and also it tries to spread some messages like the meaning of life not Ford's all time best but for sure it's inside my list next to The Star Wars Trilogy and Episode 7, Indiana Jones and The Fugitive. Great Acting, Story Effects and Direction.

title: Casino (1995)
review: Greed, deception, money, power, and murder occur between two best friends, a mafia underboss and a casino owner, for a trophy wife over a gambling empire. I just saw Casino for the first time today and my god this movie was amazing 2 great leading performances by Robert De Niro and Joe Pesci one is clever as hell and the other one is a ruthless killer that has no problem to get his hands dirty and full of blood this movie shows how dirty but also cool the Gangster world really is but on the same time it has some pretty cool violent scenes and the rest of the cast is doing a great job as well Sharon Stone, James Woods, Kevin Pollak even Don Rickles. Thanks to great characters and an amazing direction by Scorsese Casino it's just full of epicness that i can't even explain this movie is just a diamond of cinematic gold and i can also see from where American Hustle was inspired.

title: Director Ron Howard at it's best!!!
review: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish. A Beautiful Mind was actually a suggestion that a friend told me too a couple of years back and i have seen it like 2 or 3 times so far and the best thing of this is without a doubt Russell Crowe he is just magnificent in this film he gives a truly inspiring performance as Nash and so does Jennifer Connelly also Ed Harris does a great job in here and the same goes for Paul Bettany if you really haven't seen this please do it's a great dramatic movie about a man that was a pure genius and truly helped this world with his mind and director Ron Howard shows it.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio is Amazing in this!!
review: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government. The Wolf of Wall Street is a film that i had a very hard time to connect with the first time i saw it i basically skipped every scene and reached the ending and in other words i hated it but since Margot Robbie was in this and i recently saw Casino and i own it on DVD and i thought that it was amazing i said why the hell not? And i shut down and spend 3 hours of my life and i realised how wrong i was because this movie is a masterpiece with some flaws sure but masterpiece every time that Scorsese and DiCaprio work together is just amazing and if you don't believe me go watch The Departed or Gangs of New York this man can make any actor shine in a movie any day of the week for example Jonah Hill in this film is awesome and he is not one of my favorite actors like ever and yet he gave a great performance also DiCaprio who shines as always and Margot Robbie is truly great too and we have to thank Scorsese cause he brought an angel to our hearts so thank you Mr. Scorsese. Everyone in this movie is just amazing and it's truly one of those movies that this director made and it's different from others although he does take a few things from previous films of his now as for flaws there's way too many sex scenes in this film but i really didn't hated that because even movies such as The Terminator had sex scenes in it so screw it, there's also way too much cocaine too but still give me a break Scarface had too and that's one of Pacino's best movies ever there's even a scene with gay orgy and one that Hill eats a live fish and although they bothered me a bit i won't down grade the film. What i'm trying to say is that this film surprised there's a lot of great performances, money, fame and corruption and shows the big life as it should be and honestly i feel that this film was even better than Goodfellas and as good as The Departed and Casino and all those 3 films i mentioned were amazing in every way. I hope that Scorsese and DiCaprio work again together because they understand each other so much.

title: Movie Rocks!!!
